defects.title: Requirement edits lost when switching test cases
defects.description: Switching test cases before saving a shared requirement template discards unsaved changes. Warn users or auto-save the template before navigation.

defects.title: Report tab omits template metadata
defects.description: Traceability report does not list the requirement template name being applied which makes auditing difficult.

defects.title: Manual distances ignored when templates also define ranges
defects.description: If a tester records axis distances inside a test case, the report and comparison views continue to show the template's "must not respond" range instead of the recorded override, making it impossible to validate the actual field measurements.

defects.title: Comparison cards hide axis context
defects.description: When an execution is added to the comparison dashboard with a specific axis filter, the card never shows which axis/direction or distance bounds were applied. Reviewers cannot tell why runs fail without opening the original test case.

defects.title: Defect register search ignores IDs and severities
defects.description: The defect register only filters on titles/descriptions. QA cannot quickly isolate Critical defects or look up tickets by their ID, forcing manual scans of long lists.

defects.title: Requirement in Axis title
defects.description: In each individual Axis direction section (i.e. x+, y-) the "Out of range" requirement is appended to the title. But this is confusing as it indicates that is what we're testing against rather than the minimum requirement range.

defects.title: Comparison selection
defects.description: Comparing different sessions in RC3 comparison page shows a white blank page. Select a baseline and a candidate dataset, click apply and a blank page appears.

defects.title: Test Execution View too visually noise
defects.description:
Test Execution information isn't clearly separated from Test Case information, so user has to tune unnecessary information it out. 
Test Case information is necessary for the test case, but shouldn't interfere with the test execution.
- Group Test Case information together and get it a bit out of the way to put focus on test execution details.
- Make it obvious what is Test Case information and what is Test Execution information

defects.title: Add comparison button poorly placed
defects.description:
The Add to comparison button is placed in the head by the import/export buttons - This should be a Test execution specific button. 
Comparisons should be available through the tests themselves or the hardware, both of which will automatically use the selected entity from which the button was pressed, as one of the comparisons

defects.title: Importing data to existing execution
defects.description: allow imported data to be added to existing test execution. If data already exist in the selected execution, prompt to append the data, overwrite or cancel (allowing to create a new execution instead)

defects.title: Copy Test Case Details
defects.description: Add function to duplicate Test Case including Test Case information. Prompt if user want's to duplicate Test Execution data as well

defects.title: Copy Test Execution detailes
defects.description: When Creating new test executions inside a test case implement copying test details like Pass/Fail Requirements, Execution Hardware etc.

defects.title: Improve Add to comparison
defects.description:
When Clicking on "Compare Axis" user is taken directly to the Compare view without option for staying or selecting more axes, forcing the user to navigate back to the Test Execution and selecting the next Axis. When all 6 axis directions are to be compared for multiple test executions, this is wasting a lot of time. 

Solution idea: When adding a Test Execution to comparisson, prompt user which axis they want to compare. Make it selectable from within the Comparison view as well (checkboxes) 

Basically the comparison view should allow for dynamically changing the selection of comparisons. Simply add a test execution to comparison and from the Execution Card, select which axes to show (appending to the execution card, not replacing it).

Evaluate the best UX experience for solving this issue. Comparisons should be easy and functional.

defects.title: Hardware Bank vs Devices
defects.description: Menubar holds both a "Hardware Bank" and a "Devices" but seemingly only the "Devices" are used. Remove the Hardware Bank and ensure all necessary functionality is working correctly for "Devices"

defects.title: Device comparison
defects.description: Add a comparison option on Device page, allowing selection of executions with that specific device, or simply a different device, for comparison

defects.title: Defect button at bottom
defects.description:
The "New Defect" button is placed on top, and with a long lists of defects, it's tedious to scroll up to add a new defect.
Create a New Defect button at the bottom. Or simply add a new row when the bottom one is being filled in.

defects.title: Comparisson Tags
defects.description: The requirement template tag shown on the execution cards on the comparison view shows the Maximum range and "Template" as well, which it really shouldn't (i.e. "47mm · Template · Responsiveness Requirements"). It should rather just show "Responsiveness Requirements" for this tag.

defects.title: Execution Card "Cross"
defects.description:
There's a big red cross on the top right of the execution cards in the comparison view - This is used as "Remove" from comparison, but looks like a "Fail" mark.

Change the cross to actually be a pass/fail marker and add a more subtle "Remove" button further up in the top right corner

defects.title: Execution Run Terminology change
defects.description: When looking at the results of a test execution, the execution runs are named as Count in Execution Cards and in Test Report, and as Samples in the Axis Comparison Matrix - It must be named test runs.

defects.title: Device Samples
defects.description: Testing is often performed on several samples of a device type. Add a sample count for devices essentially duplicating the device information, which is generic, but serial, name and notes must be allowed for each individual sample. Devices type are Test Case specific but Samples should be Test Execution specific (still allowing several samples for each execution though)

defects.title: Axis Comparison Matrix
defects.description: "Distance" is shown in the Axis Comparison Matrix but showing the max distance, not allowing for user to actually define which distance (min or out of range requirement) should be shown. Also, requirement Tag is shown, which it shouldn't be.
